definition: thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91

sentences.english: Behind the thick lens of her glasses her blue-green eyes 3)clouded with concern.

sentences.english: Has forded your frivolous lens, I see the profound pupil.

sentences.english: The electrical circuits are embedded in the lens which creates a display within the eyeball.
sentences.chinese: 镶嵌于镜片中的电流能在眼球之内形成图像。

sentences.english: He scrambled widely to pick up the broken glasses before his guests could see them.
sentences.chinese: 他手忙脚乱地去拣摔坏了的眼镜片，免得让客人看见。

sentences.english: His daily work is to rough out the lenses for cameras.
sentences.chinese: 他每天的工作是制作照相机镜片的毛坯。

sentences.english: Yes, they are a pair of brown ladies hornrimmed spectacles with blue tinted lenses.

sentences.english: To wear glasses or corrective lenses when driving.
sentences.chinese: 驾驶时须戴眼镜或矫正视力的镜片。

sentences.english: Lens' colors or light sources may be interchanged at any time.
sentences.chinese: 镜片的颜色或光源可以随时互换。

sentences.english: The technology is an ingenious coupling of a high-power lens and the infrared LED used in remote controls.
sentences.chinese: 该产品是高倍镜片和遥控红外LED的原生组合。

sentences.english: Yes, they are a pair of brown ladies horn rimmed glasses with blur tinted lenses.

sentences.english: General low-end lenses of thick poor comfort, clarity than high-grade slightly worse.

sentences.english: He peered at me through thick glasses.
